column5: Thought some of you might enjoy this video... one method we use to haul supplies to our remote fly-in outposts is in the winter time over the winter roads and ice. This year we brought along a film-maker to capture the adventure. This trip was to Shabumeni Lake (near Birch). We are building an addition on the cabin as well as a new dock so needed lots of lumber and other supplies. This trip took place in February... there was ALOT of snow and slush up North this year!!https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R82mUge8Z_s Enjoy! Anyone else have any crazy winter adventures to share?
Cool video Wayne, wish i was there (NOT) LOL.
Never again will I feign to be annoyed as I drive to town to pick up supplies. Cool video
I enjoyed the video. I'd love to help out with something like that. At least it looks like fun sitting here in Iowa watching golf on a 70 degree day. Thanks for posting it.

Great video. Wayne, I see a reality t.v. show in your future (like you have the time!). It has all the ingredients.....trials and tribulations, danger, quirky characters, great scenery and adventure. All you need is a catchy show title...............???
Your green treated dock lumber looks like the stuff Menards sells. Crooked enough to go around corners. Nice video thanks for doing it.
Got to love utility sleds, they pull like a freight train ðŸš‚ some real work horses.
This is an example of a job you really have to love. Maybe a little nuts too. Matt
Gives you a good appreciation for the work that goes into keeping an remote fly-in operation going.. Looking forward to seeing the Clarks in a few months.
